Article Title: SC segregates SIR pleas, seeks responses from poll panel, Kerala, Bengal and Tamil Nadu
Article Text:
EC To Launch SIR in 12 States and UTs in Phase 2, CEC Gyanesh Kumar Says Zero Complaints in Bihar

NEW DELHI: Segregating petitions challenging the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal, Tamil Nadu and Kerala from the challenge to the constitutional validity of the pan-India SIR, Supreme Court on Wednesday sought responses from EC, state ECs and state govts while posting these pleas for hearing on different dates.For the Election Commission senior advocate Rakesh Dwivedi told a bench of CJI Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi that EC and Kerala State Election Commission were working in close coordination and face no problem in conducting SIR and local body elections simultaneously. The state govt has no locus standi to challenge simultaneous conduct of these two exercises.Dwivedi said over 99% of voter enumeration forms have already been distributed and over 50% of them have been digitised. The bench asked EC to file a status report on the process by Monday and posted a bunch of petitions related to the Kerala SIR for further hearing on Dec 3.On the Tamil Nadu SIR, while DMK opposed it, AIADMK supported EC's decision to carry out the revision of electoral roll. SC asked EC to file a composite affidavit on the bunch of petitions related to the state SIR and posted these for hearing on Dec 4.On the West Bengal SIR, SC issued notice on a TMC MP's plea and asked EC, state EC and Mamata Banerjee govt to file their responses by Monday and posted the bunch of petitions for hearing on Dec 9. The SIR exercise is scheduled to conclude on Dec 4. The bench said, "If we find something irregular, then we can direct the EC to correct it even if the deadline has passed."
Article Summary: Supreme Court seeks responses from EC, state ECs and state govts. Segregating petitions challenging the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal, Tamil Nadu and Kerala from the challenge to the constitutional validity of the pan-India SIR.

Article Title: Ahead of Maharashtra local polls, it’s Sena vs BJP over ‘poaching’ issues
Article Text: CHHATRAPATI SAMBHAJINAGAR: Amid rising tensions between the two constituents of the governing alliance in Maharashtra over alleged poaching of functionaries ahead of the upcoming local body polls, Shiv Sena minister Sanjay Shirsat has launched a scathing attack on Rajya Sabha MP Ashok Chavan of BJP At a rally at Bhokar in Nanded district Tuesday night, Shirsat alleged Chavan had accumulated excessive wealth. “I wonder if Ashokrao eats bhakri (kind of a thick chapati) or currency notes. Why does Ashokrao need so much money?” Shirsat said.He also targeted Chavan’s late father, former CM Shankarrao Chavan. “He used to claim Nanded would be transformed into London. I have visited Nanded multiple times. Forget the city, even Bhokar, his own hometown, remains in a bad shape to this day,” the social justice minister said.Shirsat accused Chavan of mismanagement in urban planning, alleging that public roads were marked at the cost of open spaces & official layouts.Chavan dismissed the comments as “irresponsible”. Speaking to the media in Nanded, the former CM said, “He has come here during the polls merely to pass time and divide votes. There is no basis for his comments, and such language does not suit a person holding a responsible post.”Earlier, Sena MLC Hemant Patil had blamed Chavan for the breakdown of the alliance ahead of local polls. Chavan is also facing attacks from his arch-rival Pratap Patil Chikhalikar, the NCP MLA from Loha.
Article Summary: Shiv Sena minister Sanjay Shirsat has launched a scathing attack on Rajya Sabha MP Ashok Chavan of BJP. Chavan is also facing attacks from his arch-rival Pratap Patil Chikhalikar.

Article Title: PM Modi & RSS reading Preamble a victory for founding fathers: Congress
Article Text:
File photo



PM Modi Pens Powerful Letter On Duties And Democracy, Reflects On His Constitutional Journey

NEW DELHI: Claiming RSS had opposed the newly adopted Constitution by burning the effigy of B R Ambedkar at a rally in Ramlila Maidan in 1949, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said PM Narendra Modi and RSS offering flowers to Ambedkar and reading the Preamble mark the biggest victory for the founding fathers of the republic."Today Modi lectures us on colonisation, but they belong to an ideology that boycotted the freedom struggle and sided with the British," he said, adding, "People know BJP and RSS are destroying the Constitution, and their show of respect for it is a sham."As it participated in the Constitution Day celebrations, Congress also held a nationwide protest - "samvidhan bachao divas" - to highlight "the growing attack on the Constitution marked by systematic vote theft, abuse of institutions, dubious-SIR driven attempts to distort the electoral rolls". The protest was held in all the districts, the party said.Kharge said secularism, harmony and equality became India's identity because of the Constitution, but "that identity is now under a serious threat". He added, "Today, there is an urgent need to safeguard the fundamental principles of the Constitution - justice, equality, liberty, fraternity, secularism and socialism."Leader of opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi said the Constitution represents a sacred promise of equality and justice to every citizen, irrespective of religion, caste, region, language or social status. "Let us pledge that we will not allow any attack on the Constitution. It is my duty to protect the Constitution, and I will be the first to oppose any assault on it," he said.
Article Summary: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said PM Narendra Modi and RSS offering flowers to Ambedkar and reading the Preamble mark the biggest victory for the founding fathers. Congress also held a nationwide protest - "samvidhan bachao divas" - to highlight "the growing attack on the Constitution"

Article Title: Bihar battle won, now prep for Bengal & Tamil Nadu: Amit Shah to party workers
Article Text:

The Bihar win is the triumph of NDA's unity and resolve, he said at a dinner meeting at BJP chief J P Nadda's residence to felicitate party members from different states who were deployed in the Bihar campaign.Sources said Shah also heartily praised JDU members and emphasised that people have supported the "Modi-Nitish jodi" wholeheartedly. Party workers should be ready for Bengal and Tamil Nadu elections," he said, stressing that the outcome in Bihar is an endorsement of people's love and trust for PM Modi's leadership.Party members from other states are meant to strengthen the organisational machinery for polls and should not compete for credit, he said, adding that only the Bihar unit has the right to claim credit. Article Title: Live location sharing for bail is illegal and violates privacy: HC
Article Text:
Representative image

"The condition to the effect that the petitioner 'should also share his location 24 x 7 with the IO (investigating officer) through Google' is not sustainable and the same is accordingly deleted," ordered Justice Vikas Mahajan on the plea by the accused seeking modification of the bail condition saying it was excessive, intrusive, and unsupported by law.The HC agreed and relied on the SC's 2024 judgment in Frank Vitus vs. NCB, where the apex court made it clear that technology-based tracking of an accused amounts to surveillance and is not permitted under Article 21, which protects privacy."The court cannot impose a condition on the accused to keep the police constantly informed about his movement from one place to another. The object of the bail condition cannot be to keep a constant vigil on the movements of the accused on bail," the SC noted.The SC was clear that the investigating agency cannot be permitted to "continuously peep into the private life of the accused." It would amount to keeping the accused in some kind of confinement even while on bail, the SC had said.
Article Summary: "The condition to the effect that the petitioner'should also share his location 24 x 7 with the IO (investigating officer) through Google' is not sustainable and the same is accordingly deleted," ordered Justice Vikas Mahajan. The HC agreed and relied on the SC's 2024 judgment in Frank Vitus vs NCB.

Article Title: CBI arrests key accused Abul Hossen Molla in Sandeshkhali attack case
Article Text: KOLKATA: The Central Bureau of Investigation's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) in Kolkata has arrested Abul Hossen Molla, also known as Duronto, from South 24 Parganas district in West Bengal. He was taken into custody on Wednesday evening.According to officials, Molla was allegedly involved in the mob attack on Enforcement Directorate (ED) officials in the Sandeshkhali area in January 2024.He had been absconding for months and had consistently evaded multiple notices issued by the CBI to join the investigation.A competent court had also issued a Non-Bailable Warrant (NBW) against him after he failed to appear and remained underground.CBI officials confirmed that the accused is being produced before the court today. Further investigation into the Sandeshkhali attack case is underway.Meanwhile, Sandeshkhali, a village in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district, had been in a political storm after villagers, mostly women, came out on the streets against the ruling TMC and its strongman Shahjahan, accusing him and his aides of "land-grab and sexual assault" under coercion.He was later arrested. Both the BJP and Trinamool Congress have been levelling charges against each other over Sandeshkhali.Earlier, the Calcutta High Court directed a court-monitored investigation by the CBI into the alleged cases of sexual assault and land grabbing in Sandeshkhali. The women of Sandeshkhali in the North 24 Parganas district came out on the streets earlier against the ruling TMC and Shahjahan, accusing the strongman and his aides of perpetrating gross excesses and atrocities on them while also gobbling up their land. Multiple women on the island charged Shajahan and his aides of "land-grab and sexual assault" under coercion.
Article Summary: Abul Hossen Molla, also known as Duronto, was taken into custody on Wednesday evening. Molla was allegedly involved in the mob attack on Enforcement Directorate (ED) officials in the Sandeshkhali area in January 2024. He had been absconding for months and had consistently evaded multiple notices issued by the CBI.

Article Title: Twin basketball tragedies rock Haryana: 2 teens die after rusted poles collapse; sports department orders removal of all dangerous equipment
Article Text:
Image Credit: TOI

Tragedy didn’t come without warning, say sportspersons

ROHTAK: In a span of 48 hours, two teenage basketball players died in horrific accidents in Haryana’s Rohtak and Bahadurgarh after hoop poles collapsed on them, turning courts into crime scenes and throwing aharsh spotlight on Haryana’s sports infrastructure and governance. District sports officer Anoop Singh has been suspended.A heart-wrenching CCTV video captured the death of 16-year-old schoolboy Hardik Rathi — a fivetime state player, selected for the U-17 School Nationals in Chhattisgarh — in Lakhan Majra, near Rohtak, on Tuesday.In the 9-second clip, he runs in from the three-point line, simulates a dunk, and grabs the hoop for a second — acommon habit with players. Even in the grainy footage, one can see the horror in his eyes when the 750kg pole snaps, takes him down, and crushes his ribs.Other players sprinted to Hardik’s aid and took him to hospital where he was declared ‘brought dead’. At Lakhan Majra, there is anguish & anger over the “avoidable tragedy”. Just two days earlier, there was an ominous warning when 15-year-old Aman, a Class 10 student, died in similar fashion at Bahadurgarh’s Shaheed Brigadier Hoshiar Singh stadium, some 65km from Lakhan Majra.Aman was practising on Sunday afternoon when a corroded basketball pole gave way & crashed onto his abdomen, causing severe internal injuries.The pole had allegedly been in a dilapidated condition for a long time.He was taken to the civil hospital and then to PGI-Rohtak. His family alleged that delay and negligence in treatment worsened his condition. The boy died on Monday night and his last rites were performed on Tuesday evening — when Lakhan Majra was mourning Hardik.Hardik had won a silver at the 47th Sub-Junior National Basketball Championship in Kangra, a bronze at the 49th Sub-Junior Nationals in Hyderabad and another bronze at the 39th Youth National Championship in Puducherry.Villagers and sportspersons point out the tragedy did not come without warnings. Four years ago, then Rajya Sabha MP Deepender Hooda had sanctioned Rs 11 lakh from his MPLAD fund to the Lakhan Majra panchayat for the stadium but maintenance wasn’t carried out as the tender formalities were stuck for years. A delegation met CM Nayab Saini about three months ago on this, and the tender was finally floated last week —too late for Hardik.The Lakhan Majra stadium is under the village panchayat, and a sports nursery has been running on the basketball court for a long time. After Hardik’s death, this nursery has been shut, and a committee has been formed to probe the incident and audit sports equipment. Police have seized the CCTV footage & initiated action under BNS.Shaken by the twin deaths, the Olympic association has announced that no sports event will be held in the state for the next three days. Sports minister Gaurav Gautam has called a high-level meeting on Nov 28 at Panchkula’s Tau Devi Lal Stadium with all district sports officers and senior officials to review accountability lapses, safety protocols and urgent reforms.The sports department has ordered immediate removal of all rusted, old and dangerous equipment across the state. A circular issued by the director general directed all sports officers, Motilal Nehru School of Sports in Rai, and deputy directors across Ambala, Hisar, Rohtak and Gurgaon to carry out urgent inspections and dismantle unsafe structures without delay.The deaths triggered a severe political backlash. Former CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda accused BJP govt in Haryana of treating sports and athletes “like enemies”. “Govt negligence led to the death of two promising young players. Hardik was a national-level player with a bright future, having already signed with a club in the United States,” he said.
Article Summary: Hardik Rathi, 16, was a five-time state player, selected for U-17 School Nationals in Chhattisgarh. Aman, 15, died in similar fashion at Bahadurgarh’s Shaheed Brigadier Hoshiar Singh stadium, 65km from Lakhan Majra.

NEW DELHI: JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar on Thursday took oath as the chief minister of Bihar for the 10th time at a grand ceremony held at Patna’s historic Gandhi Maidan."I congratulate my father for taking the oath as the CM the 10th time. The public gave us more than expected. I thank and also congratulate the public," Kumar said while taking oath.The swearing-in ceremony was attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, home minister Amit Shah, BJP president JP Nadda and several chief ministers from the ruling alliance marks the formation of the new NDA government following its landslide victory in the 2025 Assembly elections.Along with Nitish Kumar, 27 other ministers from NDA partners were also sworn in. The oath of office and secrecy to ministers was administered by Governor Arif Mohammed Khan.Nitish Kumar had resigned on Wednesday before staking claim to form a fresh government with NDA support. He was elected as the leader of both the JD(U) Legislature Party and the NDA Legislature Party during meetings with newly elected MLAs.BJP’s Samrat Choudhary and Vijay Kumar Sinha have been chosen as the leader and deputy leader of the BJP Legislature Party and are expected to continue in deputy CM roles.This is the fourth time Gandhi Maidan has hosted Nitish Kumar’s oath-taking ceremony, a venue closely associated with major political events in the state’s history. Elaborate security arrangements were made at the event, where lakhs of supporters gathered.The NDA swept 202 of the 243 seats in the state polls, securing a three-fourths majority. The election was seen as a crucial test for the 74-year-old Kumar who has remained central to Bihar’s politics for two decades. He first became chief minister in 2005 and has held the position continuously except for a brief nine-month period in 2014-15.The elections, held on November 6 and 11, saw a record voter turnout of 67.13%, with women voters surpassing men in participation. The results were announced on November 14.
Article Summary: JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar on Thursday took oath as the chief minister of Bihar for the 10th time. The swearing-in ceremony was attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, home minister Amit Shah, BJP president JP Nadda and several chief ministers from the ruling alliance.
